word:
The Temptations of Youth 

     The students at our college are exposed to manifold temptations. They will be brought in contact with individuals of almost every stamp of mind and morals. Those who have any religious experience are censurable if they do not place themselves in a position to resist every evil influence. But many choose to follow inclination. They do not consider that they must make or mar their own happiness. It is in their own power so to improve their 
                                                                           332
time and opportunities as to develop a character that will make them happy and useful. . . .
